=== LATEST COMMIT INFORMATION ===
Hash: 1d9ad46f
Message: :bug: Add JAVA_PROVIDER_IMAGE variable to install script (#480)

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai
-->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
* Added a configurable Java provider image: install script and CI action
now accept a Java provider image setting.
* The deployed Tackle manifest now carries the provider Java image field
so deployments use the configured image.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

---------

Hash: 0b1f678e
Message: Merge pull request #3469 from SupremeMortal/main

Fix workaround for CSV merger
Author: openshift-merge-bot[bot]
Date: 2025-10-24 17:44:32

=== WEEKLY ACTIVITY SUMMARY ===
Total Commits: 4
Total Lines Changed: 74
Active Contributors: 3

=== TOP CONTRIBUTORS (LAST WEEK) ===
1. openshift-merge-bot[bot] (2 commits)
2. Malay Kumar Parida (1 commits)
3. Owen Howard (1 commits)

=== COMMITS FROM LAST WEEK ===
- Merge pull request #3469 from SupremeMortal/main

Fix workaround for CSV merger (0b1f678e) by openshift-merge-bot[bot] on 2025-10-24 17:44:32
- Merge pull request #3559 from malayparida2000/ibm_z

Roll back the CPU adjustment for IBM Z platform for now (0d9f122a) by openshift-merge-bot[bot] on 2025-10-24 06:27:59
- Roll back the CPU adjustment for IBM Z platform for now

The requirements from the IBM Z team was to use lower CPU limits & with
higher CPU requests. But this would result in the pods loosing their
k8s guaranteed QOS class. So we adjusted both the requests & limits for
IBM Z platform. But that resulted in loss of performance. So we are
rolling back the CPU adjustment for now. We need to revisit this when
we have a better understanding of QOS working with Limits & Requests.

Signed-off-by: Malay Kumar Parida <mparida@redhat.com> (f7a44ea4) by Malay Kumar Parida on 2025-10-23 18:53:56
- Fix workaround for CSV merger

This removes the workaround that replaces descriptions containing '---'
with proper parsing of multiple YAML documents in a single file,
therefore fixing the markdown in the parsed CRD.

Signed-off-by: Owen Howard <owen@ziax.com> (37e3fd0f) by Owen Howard on 2025-09-01 22:23:15

=== LATEST COMMIT INFORMATION ===
Hash: eff6fe30
Message: Merge pull request #695 from malayparida2000/ocp_upgrade_complete

controllers: Make operator not upgradeable if OCP upgrade is incomplete
Author: openshift-merge-bot[bot]
Date: 2025-10-23 06:25:15

=== WEEKLY ACTIVITY SUMMARY ===
Total Commits: 4
Total Lines Changed: 142
Active Contributors: 2

=== TOP CONTRIBUTORS (LAST WEEK) ===
1. openshift-merge-bot[bot] (2 commits)
2. Malay Kumar Parida (2 commits)

=== COMMITS FROM LAST WEEK ===
- Merge pull request #695 from malayparida2000/ocp_upgrade_complete

controllers: Make operator not upgradeable if OCP upgrade is incomplete (eff6fe30) by openshift-merge-bot[bot] on 2025-10-23 06:25:15
- Merge pull request #694 from malayparida2000/version_matching

controllers: Make operator not upgradeable if ODF minor version is ahead of OCP (cdb8687e) by openshift-merge-bot[bot] on 2025-10-22 16:52:23
- controllers: Make operator not upgradeable if ODF version ahead of OCP

The supportability matrix allows ODF minor version to be upto n+1 ahead
of OCP minor version (i.e ODF X.Y+1, OCP X.Y). If the ODF minor
version is already ahead of OCP minor version (e.g. ODF 4.21.Z,
OCP 4.20.Z), further ODF upgrade would make it incompatible with the
current OCP version, hence mark the operator as not upgradeable.

To resolve this user would have to either upgrade OCP to the next
minor version or override the operator upgradeable condition via
the operatorCondition CR.

Signed-off-by: Malay Kumar Parida <mparida@redhat.com> (e243fb25) by Malay Kumar Parida on 2025-10-17 00:02:51
- controllers: Make operator not upgradeable if OCP upgrade is incomplete

If the OCP upgrade is incomplete, the ODF upgrade is not safe to
proceed. Hence, mark the operator as not upgradeable to ensure cluster
stability.

To resolve this user would have to either wait for the OCP upgrade to
complete or override the operator upgradeable condition via the
operatorCondition CR.

Signed-off-by: Malay Kumar Parida <mparida@redhat.com> (332389f6) by Malay Kumar Parida on 2025-10-17 02:01:46

Signed-off-by: Tamas Adam <tom@lambdac.no> (eed9d70e) by Tamas Adam on 2025-10-21 10:00:36
- Fix OIDC IDP broker basic auth encoding

Ensures that the client_id and client_secret are URL-encoded before being Base64-encoded for the Basic Auth header, following RFC 6749. This fixes authentication failures when the client_id contains special characters.

Closes #26374
Closes #43022

- Merge pull request #16629 from travisn/mon-shutdown

mon: Trap the sigterm to respond quickly to the mon canary pod deletion (9765dd93) by Santosh Pillai on 2025-10-23 11:18:27
- Merge pull request #16610 from parth-gr/fix-v2-v1-mix

external: update rook ceph mon endpoint cm to use v2 (21536e49) by Parth Arora on 2025-10-22 15:39:45
- external: update rook ceph mon endpoint cm to use v2

if v2 is enabled update the rook ceph mon endpoint cm
with v2 ports

Signed-off-by: parth-gr <partharora1010@gmail.com> (3ba911e7) by parth-gr on 2025-10-16 18:42:54
- mon: trap the sigterm in the mon canary

The mon canary should quickly shut down after the pod is
deleted, since it has no purpose to continue running.
Since the sleep does not catch the SIGTERM as pid 1,
use a bash trap to exit quickly.

Signed-off-by: Travis Nielsen <tnielsen@redhat.com> (48b70500) by Travis Nielsen on 2025-10-22 15:37:08
- Merge commit '6b333de69038ce69f9ea7fe489ffae714323bc7f' into sync_us--master

Signed-off-by: DF Build Team <df-build-team@redhat.com> (5b7c7e2e) by DF Build Team on 2025-10-24 04:06:22
- Merge pull request #16637 from hxtmdev/invalid-yaml

helm: remove duplicate YAML map entries (6b333de6) by Travis Nielsen on 2025-10-23 15:20:43
- Merge pull request #16619 from sp98/mon-canary-deletion

mon: wait for the canary pods to be terminated (e8e013d8) by Travis Nielsen on 2025-10-23 10:38:19
- Merge pull request #16614 from travisn/osd-resources-device-class

osd: Set osd resources for specific device class (66ca290f) by Travis Nielsen on 2025-10-23 09:55:09
- osd: set osd resources for specific device class

The OSDs may require different resources based on their device
class. The overall osd resources were only being used, rather
than properly looking up the specific device class resources.
Now the expected resources will take affect per device class.

Co-authored-by: Matthias Osthues <osthues.matthias@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Travis Nielsen <tnielsen@redhat.com> (d3c0bacd) by Travis Nielsen on 2025-10-16 14:33:48
- mon: wait for the canary pods to be terminated

Wait for the mon-canary pods to be terminated before starting the actual
mons. When topology spread constraints are added to evenly spread the
mons, then pod-anti affinity does not allow mons to be created on the
same node where other mons are running, this also includes the
mon-canary pods. We delete the mon-canary pods and then start the actual
mon pods. Sometimes the termination of the canary pods might take more
time, so schedular won't schedular mon pods on that node.

Signed-off-by: Santosh Pillai <sapillai@redhat.com> (3137a857) by Santosh Pillai on 2025-10-17 14:33:38
- helm: remove duplicate YAML map entries

The removed map entries are already provided by the include.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Höxtermann <daniel@hxtm.dev> (b1c58eb1) by Daniel Höxtermann on 2025-10-23 21:45:46

Signed-off-by: Elad Hazan <ehazan@redhat.com> (e2b94f8b) by Elad Hazan on 2025-10-26 16:00:58
- chore(deps): update vsphere-xcopy-volume-populator-dev-preview to 981556f

Image created from 'https://github.com/kubev2v/forklift?rev=95186bdcd901237f9726e6deb976d052ea307ea9'

Signed-off-by: red-hat-konflux <126015336+red-hat-konflux[bot]@users.noreply.github.com> (1ff9a9f8) by red-hat-konflux[bot] on 2025-10-26 10:35:45
- MTV-31078 | Feature/IBM flashsystem xcopy (#3172)

The main difference for this provider is that we do not use a host
cluster - instead we map directly to a host, this required a bit of
special handeling in the mapping and cleaning after, where the right
host to map to is given in the context, rather than being the
xcopyInitiator group.

Also note that duplication protection is more strict in this provider,
so if we have even one HBA WWPN in a host we will use that host and
ignore
other WWPNs. But if there are no hosts with any of the WWPNs we will
create a host with all of them and use that.

Assisted-by: Cursor
Signed-off-by: borod108 <boris.od@gmail.com>

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai
-->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
- FlashSystem (and Infinibox) added as supported storage vendor options;
FlashSystem end-to-end support and a new test target for FlashSystem
scenarios.

* **Bug Fixes**
- Improved cleanup: skips unmap when LUN resolution fails to avoid
unnecessary operations.

* **Documentation**
- Example test plan updated to show FlashSystem configuration and sample
host settings.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

Signed-off-by: borod108 <boris.od@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: red-hat-konflux[bot] <126015336+red-hat-konflux[bot]@users.noreply.github.com> (95186bdc) by Boris Od on 2025-10-26 03:25:40
- chore(deps): update vsphere-xcopy-volume-populator-dev-preview to 459821c

Image created from 'https://github.com/kubev2v/forklift?rev=8e9f80c1533ee7b57105d9bf419e0958acbe1fd8'

Signed-off-by: red-hat-konflux <126015336+red-hat-konflux[bot]@users.noreply.github.com> (09fd166f) by red-hat-konflux[bot] on 2025-10-26 10:11:22
- MTV-3113 | Add Infinibox storage support for vsphere-xcopy-volume-populator (#2418)

**Add InfiniBox provider**

The mapping behavior of this provider is the following: InfiniBox uses a
direct host-to-volume mapping approach where each host can be mapped to
multiple volumes through the storage array's native API. It also limits
(not as hard limit but as best practices) one host to initiators, we
handle this by implementing a three-tier host name abstraction system.

The provider will ensure that:
- A logical ESXi host name ('xcopy-esxs') is maintained consistently
across the migration process
- Real ESXi host names are used when mapping from ESXi context
(esxRealHostNameKey)
- Real OpenShift host names are used when mapping from OpenShift context
(ocpRealHostNameKey)
- Host name resolution adapts automatically based on the initiator group
context

To map a volume: call MapVolumeToHost with the appropriate host name
based on platform context.
To unmap a volume: call UnMapVolumeFromHost with the corresponding host
name.

New Features

- Added support for InfiniBox storage systems in the vSphere Xcopy
Volume Populator, enabling integration and migration workflows with
InfiniBox as a storage backend.

- Extended configuration and CRD schemas to recognize "infinibox" as a
valid storage vendor option.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai
-->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
* Added InfiniBox support for LUN discovery, mapping/unmapping,
initiator-group management, and reporting of current host mappings.

* **Chores**
* Added InfiniBox CSI driver dependency and updated Kubernetes-related
modules and numerous indirect dependencies (OpenTelemetry, gRPC,
Prometheus, etc.).
  * Added a CLI test target for InfiniBox volume copy.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai --> (8e9f80c1) by Amit on 2025-10-26 12:01:30

* Extended CLI tool downloads to support macOS ARM64, Windows AMD64, and
Linux ARM64 architectures in addition to existing platforms.

architectures.

ensure consistency across all supported platforms.

Signed-off-by: red-hat-konflux <126015336+red-hat-konflux[bot]@users.noreply.github.com> (77827ad4) by red-hat-konflux[bot] on 2025-10-22 10:01:01
- chore | Hide forkliftController hidden fields in the installer automated UI form. (#3204)

Issue:
After setting up an strict API, where feature flags are strings, the
automated UI form got very big and included some fields we did not want
to expose to the UI.

Fix:
Continue with relaxed type settings, 

 - [x] Adding new fields to the forklift controller CRD
 - [x] Hide all fields except the feature flags from the UI form

Notes:
  - YAML help include all fields
- Since CRD and UI require deterministic types, we will only accept
strings for boolean fields.

Screenshots:

Automated UI:

src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4e51a86d-ac3b-4d7c-bf83-960747fa7600"
/>

Signed-off-by: red-hat-konflux <126015336+red-hat-konflux[bot]@users.noreply.github.com> (5ff94f3a) by red-hat-konflux[bot] on 2025-10-21 21:42:11
- Fetch domain xml from libvirt for virt-v2v-in-place

Rather than constructing our own libvirt xml to pass to virt-v2v, we
should be using libvirt itself to connect to the vsphere server and
generate a domain xml file for the domain that we are trying to migrate.
This ensures that virt-v2v has as complete information as possible to
perform conversion of the domain.

This commit adds a libvirt dependency to the virt-v2v container that is
used to query libvirt for the domain xml description. We no longer need
to generate pseudo-libvirtxml in the controller and pass it down to the
conversion pod via ConfigMap. But we do need to pass the host secret
down to the conversion pod in the same way that we do when we're not
converting in-place since we now need to connect to the source provider
(via libvirt) for this use case.

Resolves: MTV-2799

Signed-off-by: Jonathon Jongsma <jjongsma@redhat.com> (86b6d5fd) by Jonathon Jongsma on 2025-07-09 11:25:05
- Install libvirt packages for all github workflows

Resolves: MTV-2799

Signed-off-by: Jonathon Jongsma <jjongsma@redhat.com> (907f7aea) by Jonathon Jongsma on 2025-07-17 14:07:14
- Add libvirt vendor module

Resolves: MTV-2799

Signed-off-by: Stefan Olenocin <solenoci@redhat.com> (d0cdcd34) by Stefan Olenocin on 2025-10-21 13:24:53
- No Jira | Customize PipelineRun for OVA Proxy (#3252)

Resolves: none

Signed-off-by: Stefan Olenocin <solenoci@redhat.com> (3eeaa8bd) by Stefan Olenocin on 2025-10-21 12:47:08
- Red Hat Konflux update forklift-ova-proxy-dev-preview (#3250)

# Pipelines as Code configuration proposal

To start the PipelineRun, add a new comment with content `/ok-to-test`

For more detailed information about running a PipelineRun, please refer
to Pipelines as Code documentation [Running the
PipelineRun](https://pipelinesascode.com/docs/guide/running/)

To customize the proposed PipelineRuns after merge, please refer to
[Build Pipeline
customization](https://konflux-ci.dev/docs/how-tos/configuring/)

Please follow the block sequence indentation style introduced by the
proprosed PipelineRuns YAMLs, or keep using consistent indentation level
through your customized PipelineRuns. When different levels are mixed,
it will be changed to the proposed style.

Signed-off-by: red-hat-konflux <konflux@no-reply.konflux-ci.dev>
